member.name: M:ModApi.AssetDatabase.GetAssetPath(UnityEngine.Object)
member.summary: Gets the path name relative to the project folder where the asset is stored. All paths are relative to the project folder, for example: "Assets/MyTextures/hello.png".
member.param: A reference to the asset for which to get the path.
member.returns: The path name relative to the project folder where the asset is stored.
member.exception: Could not find the 'GetAssetPath' method via reflection for the AssetDatabase.

member.name: M:ModApi.AssetDatabase.GetAssetResourcesPath(UnityEngine.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the path name relative to the resources folder where the asset is stored. If the asset cannot be found in the resources folder, a null is returned.
member.param: A reference to the asset for which to get the path.
If set to true, the file extension will be removed before returning the path.
member.returns: The path name relative to the resources folder where the asset is stored or null if it could not be found.

member.summary: The PID used to tune this PID's gain values.

member.summary: The last error

member.summary: Experimental utility to adjust pids based on how much the craft is oscillating.

member.name: M:ModApi.Automation.PidController.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ModApi.Automation.PidController.PidHandler
member.summary: Handler for PID events.

member.name: P:ModApi.Automation.PidController.AutoResetWhenErrorSignChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether to automaticly reset the pid controller when the sign of the error changes. This can be used to prevent oscillations in some circumstances.
member.value: true if automaticly reset the pid controller when the sign of the error changes; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ModApi.Automation.PidController.ErrorAccum
member.summary: Gets the accumulated error (integral) over a given period of time. Used by the integral component to correct for accumulated errors.

member.name: P:ModApi.Automation.PidController.ErrorMaxAccum
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum accumulatable error (integral) value, or null to not limit the maximum. Note: Setting this to null will attempt to "unwind" all accumulated errors. If, for instance this is used on a helicopter tail and the tail blows out, causing the pid to accumulate 2 full circles of error (very extreme case), the PID will attempt to remove all 2 * 2PI radians...which would not typically be desireable.

member.name: P:ModApi.Automation.PidController.PidGains
member.summary: Gets or sets the PID gain values (x=proportional, y=integral, z=derivative).

member.name: P:ModApi.Automation.PidController.Value
member.summary: Gets the last output value from the PID system.
member.value: The last output value from the PID system.

member.name: P:ModApi.Automation.PidController.ValueComponents
member.summary: Gets the individual pid value components which make up the final value (x=proportional, y=integral, z=derivative). Used for debugging/tuning the pid.

member.name: M:ModApi.Automation.PidController.MakeCopy
member.summary: Makes a copy of the Pid Controller.
member.returns: A copy of the Pid Controller.

member.name: M:ModApi.Automation.PidController.Reset
member.summary: Resets any inter-frame PID system values such as those related to errors. The PID system will operate as if it were newly created, yet with the current PID gain values.

member.name: M:ModApi.Automation.PidController.Update(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary: Updates the PID system and returns the value suggested to correct for the supplied error.
member.param: The current value of the item being optimized by the PID controller.
An optional substitute value to use for the derivative term.
member.returns: The value suggested to correct for the supplied error.

member.name: M:ModApi.Automation.PidController.CalculatePID(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary: Calculates the PID output given the supplied inputs.
member.param: An optional substitute value to use for the derivative term.
member.returns: The individual PID value components...should be added together to get the final value.

member.name: M:ModApi.Automation.PidController.UpdatePID(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Nullable{System.Single})
member.summary: Updates the PID system and returns the value suggested to correct for the supplied error.
member.param: The current value of the item being optimized by the PID controller.
An optional substitute value to use for the derivative term.
member.returns: The value suggested to correct for the supplied error.

member.summary: A helper class that wraps the functionality necessary to queue an action to run once on the next update cycle. The action will execute immediately after all the update methods have executed.

member.summary: The MonoBehaviour on which we are logically invoking the coroutine.

member.summary: A value indicating whether or not the action is currently queued.

member.summary: Queues the action to run on the next update unless it has already been queued.

member.summary: Gets the manager object. This is the true MonoBehaviour on which the coroutine is run.

member.summary: The actual coroutine to execute.

member.name: T:ModApi.Common.Events.EventMigrator`1
member.summary: Class to facilitate subscribing to a "migrating" event. Example use-case: "As a gizmo, I want to subscribe to a parts's 's event." Normally this is a big pain because you are subscribing to a specific command pod's events instead of the idea of "this part's craft nodes's active command pod". The active command pod may change, and the part may also be moved to another craft/node entirely. In this case you'd setup migration triggers for and , which will automatically rewire the events when either of those triggers occur to keep subscribers getting notified properly.
member.typeparam: The class type which contains the migrating event to be tracked.

member.name: F:ModApi.Common.Events.EventMigrator`1._actionOnMigration
member.summary: The (optional) action to perform when an even migration occurs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Common.Events.EventMigrator`1._getEventObject
member.summary: The action to get the object on which the event resides.

member.summary: The migration trigger data.

member.summary: The object which containes the event subscribed to.

member.summary: The subscribe

member.summary: The unsubscribe

member.summary: The handler data

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

An action used to unsubscribe to the event on the supplied object.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A function which returns the object on which the event to subscribe to resides.
An action used to subscribe to the event on the supplied object.
An action used to unsubscribe to the event on the supplied object.
The action to perform when an even migration occurs, or null if no action should be performed.

member.name: M:ModApi.Common.Events.EventMigrator`1.AddMigrationTrigger``1(System.Func{``0},System.Action{ModApi.Common.Events.EventMigrator{`0},``0},System.Action{ModApi.Common.Events.EventMigrator{`0},``0})
member.summary: Adds a migration trigger. When the migration trigger event occurs, it will cause the primary event to be unsubscribed from and re-subscribed using an updated target object.
member.typeparam: The type containing the migration event trigger.
member.param: A function which returns the object on which the event to subscribe to resides.
An action which subscribes to the migration trigger event.
An action which unscribes to the migration trigger event and is supplied an object reference to unsubscribe from.

member.name: T:ModApi.Common.Textures.Screenshots
member.summary: Functionality related to taking screen-shots.

member.name: M:ModApi.Common.Textures.Screenshots.GetScreenShotSampleRect(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets a rect identifying where from the current screen to obtain a screen-shot of the desired aspect ratio. If the aspect ratio is different than the current resolution, some clipping will occur.
member.returns: A rect identifying where from the current screen to obtain a screen-shot of the desired aspect ratio.

member.name: M:ModApi.Common.Textures.Screenshots.TakeScreenShot(UnityEngine.Vector2i,System.Action{UnityEngine.Texture2D})
member.summary: Takes a screen-shot of the screen's current contents. The final image will be at the specified resolution. Cropping will occur if the specified resolution's aspect ratio is different from the current one.
member.param: The final resolution of the screen-shot.
Action to call when the screen-shot has been captured..
member.remarks: screenSampleRect and resolution must have the same aspect ratio, or the final image will be skewed. It does not have to match the current resolution, however.

member.name: M:ModApi.Common.Textures.Screenshots.TakeScreenShot(UnityEngine.Rect,UnityEngine.Vector2i,System.Action{UnityEngine.Texture2D})
member.summary: Takes a screen-shot of the current screen's contents. The final image will consist of whatever is inside the screenSampleRect, and at the specified resolution. Cropping will occur if the specified resolution's aspect ratio is different from the current one.
member.param: The location within the current screen to capture a screen-shot.
The final resolution of the screen-shot.
Action to call when the screen-shot has been captured..
member.remarks: screenSampleRect and resolution must have the same aspect ratio, or the final image will be skewed. It does not have to match the current resolution, however.

member.name: M:ModApi.Common.Textures.Screenshots.CaptureScreenshot(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Captures the screenshot.
member.param: Factor by which to increase resolution.
member.returns: The path to the screenshot file.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.BodyJointData.ConnectedBodyNeutralPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the connected body's neutral joint position in coordinates local to , or null if the current position is its neutral position. This value defines the position where the joint tries to bring the connected body back to...ie, the neutral position. It prevent joints from being "welded" into place when they're saved while they're bent, and could also be used to pre-tension joints for use in things like sling-shots.
member.value: The connected body's neutral joint position, local to .
member.remarks: If the value from xml is null, this property will be updated with the current position upon initial joint creation.

member.name: T:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint
member.summary: An attach point where a part can connect to another part.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._allowInvertedConnection
member.summary: A value indicating whether this attach point can connect to another attach point with its normal pointing in the wrong direction. This requieres that the attach point also supports AllowRotation.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._allowRotation
member.summary: A value indicating whether the attach point allows rotation.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._canReceive
member.summary: A value indicating whether this attach point can receive attachments. This will usually be true. An example of an attach point which would be false is the auto-rotating fuselage attach point. That attach point is used to attach the fuselage to other pieces, but we don't want pieces attaching themselves to that point...other pieces attach to the fuselage via its surface attach point.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._canSeek
member.summary: A value indicating whether this attach point can cast rays looking for connections when its part is being moved in the designer. This is usually true, but for surface attach points and in some special cases this can be false.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._connectionType
member.summary: The attach point's connection type, which determines what attach points this attach point can connect to.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._disableJointCollisions
member.summary: A value indicating whether to disable collisions for a physics joint created at this attach point. This only applies if the attach point is not a Fused type. If this flag is different between the two attach points making up a joint, then the physics joint will be created with collisions disabled.

member.summary: The display name

member.summary: The value indicating whether this attach point is hidden.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._ignoreSurfaces
member.summary: A value indicating whether to ignore connections with surface attach points.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._jointType
member.summary: The type of the joint created by this attach point.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._localJointAxis

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._radius
member.summary: The radius, which is used by adaptive fuselage meshes to automatically adapt to the radius of the attach point. If the radius is zero, then the fuselage meshes will not attempt to auto-adapt to this attach point.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.AttachPoint._rayCastFromCursor
member.summary: A value indicating whether to cast the ray from the cursor instead of from the attach point. Some parts that auto-rotate are easier to use if the ray cast is from the cursor, such as the fuel tank.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.Parts.DesignerPart._iconPath
member.summary: This is the path to the designer part icon image. For auto-generated icons, this is unnecessary, however it may still be specified for manual control of the file name. For 'File' type icons, this is the path (relative to the part icon folder) where the part icon image is located. For both cases if left blank, the name of the designer part will be used. For 'Resource' type icons, this is a required field and should point to the asset path in the mod where the icon image can be loaded.

member.summary: Gets the current stage number. This is the stage index + 1. A value of zero indicates no stages have activated yet.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.Parts.ICommandPodScript.GetStageActivationPermission
member.summary: Gets or sets an optional function that the command pod will use to check if it can advance to the next stage. This can be used to limit the stage activation for whatever reason, such as in the flight tutorial where we don't want the player running through stage activations before they're ready. In normal circumstances, this should be null. The function must return a true to allow stage activation, or false to prevent it. The int parameter is the stage that is requesting activation.

member.summary: Gets the inertia tensor minimum, which is the minimum amount of inertia tensor to use in a body that contains this part.

member.summary: Gets the user-defined inertia tensor scale. part

member.name: T:ModApi.Craft.Parts.PartData
member.summary:
A part is a complete object, which is either added or removed as a whole in the designer. This is different from "Modifiers" which may be used to change a Part's behavior. Once constructed, parts are capable of producing XML to fully describe themselves, or a UNITY GameObject to do the same. Typically, it is only used used for IO purposes, such as saving to an xml file, or loading from XML to create an object for design/simulation.
The Part class defines an object in its entirety. If you can construct an Part by any fashion, you should be able to get a GameObject, and use it in simulation mode. Likewise, any Part (GameObject w/a PartScript) should be able to be used to construct a Part and used to generate XML for saving purposes.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.Parts.PartData.BuoyancyScale
member.summary: Gets the value to scale this part's buoyancy by. A value of 1 would indicate default buoyancy for the volume of this part's collider. A value lower would indicate that the part is porous. Set to zero to disable buoyancy for a part. This is a rolled-up value based on BuoyancyBaseScale and BuoyancyUserScale.
member.value: The value to scale this part's buoyancy by.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.Parts.PartData.PreferredNodeName
member.summary: Gets or sets the preferred node name assigned to this part. If this part is the root part when the craft is created, its value will be used to set the craft node's name. As long as it is the root part, any changes to the node's name will also be made to this property (but not vice versa). If set to null, default craft node naming will be used.
member.value: The name of the preferred node.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.Parts.PartData.SymmetryMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the symmetry mode for the part. This is not serialized (at least not at the time of this comment) and it is only used in the designer for convenience so the designer doesn't forget what symmetry mode to use for a part if it is pulled of briefly from the craft. This is only set on the root part of the SymmetrySlice. For checking symmetry mode, use PartScript.SymmetrySlice.SymmetryGroup.SymmetryMode

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.Parts.PartData.Tag

The part for which the modifier is being crated.

member.name: M:ModApi.Craft.Parts.PartModifierScript.RecalculateFrameState(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Called when a modifier should recalulate the reference frame sate (position/velocity) of any special, "unmanaged" game-objects.
member.remarks: Any children of a craft should have their position updated without using the position delta. However, any rigid-body other than the one associated with a will need its velocity updated with the velocity delta. Any gameobject not under a craft should add both the position and velocity deltas to the current value to keep the same relative state. - Caution: This may be called either when the reference frame recenters, rotates, or when the node's orbit position/velocity is manually updated such as while warping. If subscribing to , do not also add deltas in response to that or they'll be added in twice.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.IBodyWaterPhysics.IsPrecisionModePerPart
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current precision mode processes individual parts for water physics, or solely at the rigid body level. This is used to allow PartWaterPhysics objects to know if they need to manually forward water related events since their Update method won't be called.
member.value: true if the current precision mode processes individual parts for water physics; otherwise, false to signify it is calculated solely at the rigid body level.

member.name: T:ModApi.Craft.ICraftLoader
member.summary: An interface for an object containing functionality for loading craft data.

member.name: M:ModApi.Craft.ICraftLoader.LoadCraftImmediate(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the craft with the specified ID. This will show no message dialogs or errors and will attempt to force the loading of craft with potential issues (version or mod requirements not met). Some errors may be logged and exceptions could be thrown for show-stopping errors.
member.returns: The requested craft.

member.name: M:ModApi.Craft.ICraftLoader.LoadCraftImmediate(System.Xml.Linq.XElement)
member.summary: Loads the craft with the specified XML. This will show no message dialogs or errors and will attempt to force the loading of craft with potential issues (version or mod requirements not met). Some errors may be logged and exceptions could be thrown for show-stopping errors.
member.returns: The requested craft.

member.name: M:ModApi.Craft.ICraftLoader.LoadCraftInteractive(System.String,System.Action{ModApi.Craft.CraftData},System.Action)
member.summary: Loads the craft with the specified ID. This may be an interactive process, with message dialogs or errors being shown before completing. As such, the craft may not be loaded immediately. In fact, the craft may not be loaded at all due to errors or cancellation. The success callback will be invoked if the craft was loaded successfully (not necessarily without issues though). The failure callback will be invoked for any show-stopping errors that were encountered or if the loading was canceled.

member.name: M:ModApi.Craft.ICraftLoader.LoadCraftInteractive(System.Xml.Linq.XElement,System.Action{ModApi.Craft.CraftData},System.Action)
member.summary: Loads the craft with the specified XML. This may be an interactive process, with message dialogs or errors being shown before completing. As such, the craft may not be loaded immediately. In fact, the craft may not be loaded at all due to errors or cancellation. The success callback will be invoked if the craft was loaded successfully (not necessarily without issues though). The failure callback will be invoked for any show-stopping errors that were encountered or if the loading was canceled.

member.name: T:ModApi.Craft.WaterPhysicsHandler`1
member.summary: General event handler related to body scripts.

member.name: T:ModApi.Craft.PrecisionModeType
member.summary: The physics precision seting for water.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.PrecisionModeType.NotifyOnly
member.summary: Does the absolute minimum to raise events. No physics are applied.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.PrecisionModeType.Low
member.summary: Will report either 0 or 1 for UnderWaterAmount (either fully submerged, or not at all). Does bare minimum to provide buoyancy.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.PrecisionModeType.Med
member.summary: Same as Low, except will perform a few additional physics operations to stabilize an object on the surface of the water.

member.name: F:ModApi.Craft.PrecisionModeType.High
member.summary: Will calculate a value ranging from 0 to 1 depending on how much the object is submerged.

member.value: The part volume in cubic meters.

member.summary: For interacting with water physics.

member.summary: Occurs when the body has entered the water.

member.summary: Occurs when the body has exited the water.

member.summary: Occurs while the body is in the water.

member.summary: Gets the body script.

member.summary: Gets the volume currently displaced by the part.
member.value: The volume currently displaced by the part.

member.summary: Gets the volume currently displaced by the object, scaled by BuoyancyScale.
member.value: The volume currently displaced by the object, scaled by BuoyancyScale.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is fully submerged.
member.value: true if this instance is fully submerged; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.IWaterPhysics`1.IsInWater
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this instance is in water.
member.value: true if this instance is in water; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.IWaterPhysics`1.PrecisionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the precision mode.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.IWaterPhysics`1.TotalDisplacementVolume
member.summary: Gets the total displacement volume of this object, ie. the volume of fluid it would displace if it were fully submerged. Normally equal to the it's collider volume unless it is porous...or "empty", like a rocket nozzle would be.
member.value: The total displacement volume of this part.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.IWaterPhysics`1.TotalDisplacementVolumeScaled
member.summary: Gets the total displacement volume, scaled by BuoyancyScale.
member.value: The total displacement volume of this part.

member.name: P:ModApi.Craft.IWaterPhysics`1.UnderWaterAmount
member.summary: Gets a value indicating how much this object is under water, from 0 to 1. Zero meaning not under water at all, and one meaning fully submerged.
member.value: The value indicating how much this object is under water, from 0 to 1 Zero meaning not under water at all, and one meaning fully submerged.

member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources.

member.summary: Updates the water physics for this object.

member.name: T:ModApi.Craft.Program.Thread
member.summary: Smallest unit of instruction processing in a Vizzy Process. It contains its own memory stack, however it shares global variables with other threads. This thread class is not to be confused with a system thread and it is not asynchronous and is not even guaranteed to be thread safe.

member.summary: Gets the altitude compensation factor from 0-1, which indicates how much the nozzle compensates for atmospheric pressure. Zero indicates no altitude compensation and nozzle exit pressure is calculated normally. One indicates perfect compensation so that the exit pressure is always equal to the atmospheric pressure. Values in between lerp between chamber pressure and atmospheric pressure by this percentage.

member.name: T:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveStyle
member.summary: The style of the curve. This enumeration is the same as the enumeration except a few enumeration value names have been changed to be more XML user friendly.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveStyle.Custom
member.summary: The tangents are manually set. Same as AnimationCurveTangentMode.Free.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveStyle.SmoothUnclamped
member.summary: The tangents are automatically set to make the curve go smoothly through the key. Same as AnimationCurveTangentMode.Auto.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveStyle.Linear
member.summary: The tangent points towards the neighboring key. Same as AnimationCurveTangentMode.Linear.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveStyle.Constant
member.summary: The curve retains a constant value between two keys. Same as AnimationCurveTangentMode.Constant.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveStyle.Smooth
member.summary: The tangents are automatically set to make the curve go smoothly through the key and prevent overshooting. Same as AnimationCurveTangentMode.ClampedAuto.

member.name: T:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveWrapMode
member.summary: An enumeration defining the wrap modes for a user curve. The enumeration values match those in so they can be cast back and forth.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveWrapMode.Loop
member.summary: The curve will loop back to the beginning of the curve when it reaches the end.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveWrapMode.PingPong
member.summary: The curve will ping pong back and forth between the beginning of the curve and end of the curve.

member.name: F:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.CurveWrapMode.Clamp
member.summary: The curve will be clamped to the beginning and end positions, never extending beyond those times.

member.name: M:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.GetKeyframesAsString
member.summary: Gets the keyframes as a string value. Each keyframe should be separated by the '|' character, with each keyframe having values separated by the ',' character. Each keyframe should consist of a time value and an output value. If custom tangents are used, then there will be two additional values representing the incoming tangent and the outgoing tangent.
member.returns: The keyframes encoded as a string value.

member.summary: Gets the value of the curve at the specified time, ignoring the curve's current time value.

member.summary: Sets the keyframes for the curve.
member.param: The keyframes to be set on the curve.

member.name: M:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.SetKeyframes(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the keyframes on the curve based on the specially formatted keyframe string. Each keyframe should be separated by the '|' character, with each keyframe having values separated by the ',' character. A keyframe should define a time value and an output value. Optionally, the keyframe may specify a third value the defines the incoming and outgoing tangents, or a third and fourth value that define the incoming and outgoing tangents respectively. Example: 0.0,0.0|0.5,1.0|1.0,0.0
member.param: The keyframes to be set on the curve.

member.name: M:ModApi.Data.UserCurve.AddKeyframes(UnityEngine.AnimationCurve,System.String)
member.summary: Adds the keyframes defined in the specially formatted string to the specified .
member.param: The string defining the keyframes to be added.

member.summary: Called when the should re-calculate its state (position/velocity) within the reference frame. This may be called whenever the reference frame has been recentered, when the reference frame is rotated (if it is surface locked), or any time this object's coordinates (i.e. orbital params) are manually changed outside the physics simulation (ex. warp).

member.summary: Gets the rotation of the frame (in radians). No rotation means the reference frame is aligned with the planet's non-rotated coordinate system.

member.summary: Gets the surface velocity of the reference frame, which is the velocity of the reference frame relative to the surface of the planet directly below the reference frame.

member.summary: Gets the velocity of the frame.

member.summary: Gets the water wave offset, in frame coordinates. This is used to keep the frame position of wave sample points consistent across reference frame re-centers. It should be subtracted from the a frame position to get a consistent water wave sample position.
member.value: The water wave offset, in frame coordinates.

member.summary: Converts a frame position to planet position.
member.returns: The planet position.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.FrameToPlanetRotation(UnityEngine.Quaternion)
member.summary: Converts from the frame rotation to the planet rotation.
member.returns: The planet rotation.

member.summary: Converts fhe vector from frame coordinates to planet coordinates.
member.returns: The planet vector.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.FrameToPlanetVelocity(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Converts from frame velocity to planet velocity.
member.returns: The planet velocity.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.GetAltitudeAsl(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the altitude, above sea level, for the given frame position.
member.param: If set to true the altitude includes sea level displacement caused by waves, otherwise false to use the "base" sea level.
member.returns: The altitude, above sea level, for the given frame position.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.GetWaterPosBelowPoint(UnityEngine.Vector3,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the water position, in frame coordinates (without wave offset) below/above a given frame position.
member.param: If set to true the point will be displaced by waves, otherwise false to use the "base" sea level.
member.returns: The water position, in frame coordinates (without wave offset) below/above a given frame position.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.GetWaterWaveOffset(UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Gets the water wave offset for a given frame position, using the current planet's water properties.
member.returns: The water wave offset for a given frame position, using the current planet's water properties.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.PlanetToFramePosition(UnityEngine.Vector3d)
member.summary: Converts a planet position to frame position.
member.returns: The frame position.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.PlanetToFramePositionAtTime(UnityEngine.Vector3d,System.Double)
member.summary:
Converts a planet position to the position it will be within the reference frame at a given point in time. This is useful if you want to predict a point that the craft will pass through in the reference frame using the node's orbit.
Note: If you were to simply call the PlanetToFramePosition() with a node's future planet position, it would return a position which is incredibly far away from where it will actaully be in the reference frame b/c the reference frame's velocity isn't taken into account. This method does that.
member.returns: The frame position.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.PlanetToFramePositiond(UnityEngine.Vector3d)
member.summary: Converts a planet position to frame position. Returns a Vector3d instead of a Vector3 for increased precision.
member.returns: The frame position as double precision Vector3.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.PlanetToFrameRotation(UnityEngine.Quaterniond)
member.summary: Converts from planet rotation to frame rotation.
member.returns: The frame rotation.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.PlanetToFrameVector(UnityEngine.Vector3d)
member.summary: Converts the vector from planet coordinates to frame coordinates.
member.returns: The vector converted from planet coordinates to frame coordinates.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.GameView.IReferenceFrame.PlanetToFrameVelocity(UnityEngine.Vector3d)
member.summary: Converts from planet velocity to frame velocity.
member.returns: The frame velocity.

member.name: T:ModApi.Flight.MapView.AdjustmentSpaceType
member.summary: Defines the types of burn node adjustment types.

member.name: F:ModApi.Flight.MapView.AdjustmentSpaceType.Relative
member.summary: When relative is used, the burn vector keeps the original prograde/normal/radial magnitudes, and as a result the world-space vector can change (ex: when previous nodes change).

member.name: F:ModApi.Flight.MapView.AdjustmentSpaceType.World
member.summary: When world is used, the burn vector is a static world-space vector, and as a result the prograde/normal/radial magnitudes can change (ex: when previous nodes change).

member.name: T:ModApi.Flight.MapView.GizmoAlignmentType
member.summary: Defines the types of burn node adjustment types.

member.name: F:ModApi.Flight.MapView.GizmoAlignmentType.ReferenceOrbit
member.summary: The gizmo will align with the reference orbit, and thus will not change when adjusting a maneuver node.

member.name: P:ModApi.Flight.Sim.IOrbit.ApoapsisDistanceEffective
member.summary: Gets the effective apoapsis distance for this orbit. For elliptical orbits, this will be the same as . For hyperbolic orbits, this will be the value returned when the distance is calculated for . For hyperbolics, the true distance is infinity, but due to precision anything beyond will result in precision issues...things will begin to equate to equal when they should not be, things will begin to fail to converge, etc. Note: This is not a guaranteed "safe" distance...it is still far as hell out, and may run into issues.
member.value: The effective apoapsis distance for this orbit.

member.value: true if debug is enabled for this orbit. Its just a flag that can be used to spit out debug info for a specific orbit instead of all of 'em.; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets see for more info.
member.value: The maximum valid eccentric anomaly for this orbit.

member.summary: Gets the eccentricity.

member.name: P:ModApi.Flight.Sim.IOrbit.EccentricityVector
member.summary: Gets the eccentricity vector.

members.member:
Gets the theoretical ceiling for the true anomaly of this orbit if it is hyperbolic. Hyperbolic orbits have a true anomaly limit that they approach, but never obtain, nor cross since hyperbolic orbits never complete a circle. If the true anomaly is set to this value, the position/velocity/time would go to infinity, so it should be used as a non-inclusive ceiling/limit. For elliptical orbits it will be NaN and should be ignored.
The maximum valid true anomaly for this orbit.
Use for the maximum true anomaly value that this orbit should ever be set to.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.Sim.IPlanetNode.CalculateSurfaceVelocity(UnityEngine.Vector3d)
member.summary: Calculates the velocity of a point on the surface of the planet. The velocity vector is in surface coordinates. In order to convert that to planet coordinates, it needs to be multiplied by the planet's rotation quaternion. Here's a very poor diagram: http://imgur.com/852uxET
member.param: The surface point. The magnitude of this point should be equal to the radius of the planet.
member.returns: The velocity in surface coordinates.

member.summary: Gets the latitude and longitude from the surface position. Zero lat and zero long would be (0,0,1) on a planet of radius 1.
member.param: The latitude in radians, which can be -PI to PI. Zero is the equator.
The longitude in radians, which can be Zero to 2*PI.

member.name: M:ModApi.Flight.Sim.IPlanetNode.GetSurfacePosition(System.Double,System.Double,ModApi.Flight.Sim.AltitudeType,System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the surface position from lat/long/altitude coordinates. Zero lat and zero long would be (0,0,1) on a planet of radius 1.
member.param: The latitude in radians, which can be -PI to PI. Zero is the equator.
The longitude in radians, which can be Zero to 2*PI.
Type of the altitude. If AboveGroundLevel is provided, the terrain data must be loaded.
The altitude above sea level or ground level, depending on the altitude type.
member.returns: The surface position.

member.name: M:ModApi.GameLoop.Interfaces.IFlightPreFixedUpdate.FlightPreFixedUpdate(ModApi.GameLoop.FlightFrameData@)
member.summary: FixedUpdate method that executes before other game loop FixedUpdate methods and is only called in the flight scene when the game is not paused and when not warping.

member.name: T:ModApi.GameLoop.Interfaces.IFlightPreFixedUpdateParallel
member.summary: An interface for an object that is updated, potentially in parallel, prior to the FixedUpdate method of other game loop scripts during the FixedUpdate loop in the flight scene when the game is not paused and the player is not warping.

member.name: M:ModApi.GameLoop.Interfaces.IFlightPreFixedUpdateParallel.FlightPreFixedUpdateParallel(ModApi.GameLoop.FlightFrameData@)
member.summary: FixedUpdate method that executes before other game loop FixedUpdate methods and is only called in the flight scene when the game is not paused and when not warping. This may or may not be executed in parallel on background threads.

member.name: M:ModApi.GameLoop.Interfaces.IFlightPreLateUpdateParallel.FlightPreLateUpdateParallel(ModApi.GameLoop.FlightFrameData@)
member.summary: LateUpdate method that executes before other game loop LateUpdate methods and is only called in the flight scene when the game is not paused. This may or may not be executed in parallel on background threads.

member.summary: Loads the prefab at the specified path and then instantiates and returns it.

member.summary: Registers the object as a valid ioc context. Allows callers to register instances associated with the given context.
member.remarks: To free resources, should be called when the context is no-longer valid.

member.returns: The resolved instance of the given type.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Calculates the specific impulse.

member.name: M:ModApi.Math.MathUtils.ComputeRotationContributions(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Transform,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates which rotational axes (x=pitch, y=yaw, z=roll) a force at the supplied position and in the given direction would primarily contribute to, relative to the CoM. 1 = max amount, 0 = none.
member.param: The position where the force is applied, in world coordinates.
The normalized force direction, in world coordinates.
Center of mass transform which is positioned at the CoM and aligned with the desired control orientation from the pilot's perspective of: forward=roll, up=yaw, and right=pitch.
If set to true the contribution values will be inverted.
If set to true only the greatest contributing axis will be used.
Threshold which must be achieved to register a contribution for a particular axis. Lower number means contribution will be more easily registered.
member.returns: Vector3 containing -1, 0, or 1 for each axis (x=Pitch, y=Yaw, z=Roll), identifying which control inputs would be primarily contributed to if a force were applied at the given position/direction.

member.name: M:ModApi.Math.MathUtils.ComputeTranslationContributions(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Transform,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates which translational axes (x=right/left, y=up/down, z=forward/back) a force at the supplied position and in the given direction would primarily contribute to, relative to the CoM. 1 = max amount, 0 = none.
member.param: The position where the force is applied, in world coordinates.
The normalized force direction, in world coordinates.

Center of mass transform which is positioned at the CoM and aligned with the desired control orientation from the pilot's perspective of: forward=toward the front of the pilot, up=toward pilot's head, and right=toward the pilot's right.
If set to true the contribution values will be inverted.
If set to true only the greatest contributing axis will be used.
Threshold which must be achieved to register a contribution for a particular axis. Lower number means contribution will be more easily registered.
member.returns: Vector3 containing -1, 0, or 1 for each axis (x=right/left, y=up/down, z=forward/back), identifying which control inputs would be primarily contributed to if a force were applied at the given position/direction.

member.name: M:ModApi.Math.MathUtils.ConvertAngularToLinearVelocity(UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3,UnityEngine.Vector3)
member.summary: Converts an angular velocity to a linear velocity, sampled at the given point. As long as all the inputs are relative to the same reference (world or local) it doesn't matter, linear velocity returned will match.
member.param: The position to sample linear velocity from.
member.returns: The linear velocity of a point at the provided sample point.

member.name: M:ModApi.Math.MathUtils.FmodComponents(UnityEngine.Vector3d,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns a vector with each resulting component having been ran through the fmod function.
member.param: The input vector to fmod each component.
member.returns: The vector with each resulting component having been ran through the fmod function

member.name: M:ModApi.Math.MathUtils.GetFirstExternalRayIntersectionWithSphere(UnityEngine.Vector3d,System.Double,UnityEngine.Ray3d,UnityEngine.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Gets the first point of a ray intersecting a sphere. This only works for ray origins external to the sphere. This will return true if the ray origin is outside of the sphere and the ray intersects the sphere. http://kylehalladay.com/blog/tutorial/math/2013/12/24/Ray-Sphere-Intersection.html
member.param: The first intersection point if the function returns true.
member.returns: true if the ray origin is outside of the sphere and the ray intersects the sphere, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ModApi.Math.MathUtils.GetIntersectionWithRadius(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the intersection with radius.
member.returns: true if there is an intersection; false otherwise.

member.name: M:ModApi.Math.MathUtils.GetIntersectionWithSphere(UnityEngine.Vector3d,System.Double,UnityEngine.Vector3d,UnityEngine.Vector3d,UnityEngine.Vector3d@)
member.summary: Gets the point on the outside of the sphere which intersects with intersectingRay. The ray's origin must be inside the sphere.
member.param: A direction outside the sphere, pointing to the desired intersection point.
member.returns: true if an intersection is found, otherwise false.

member.summary: Converts the latitude and longitude to a unit vector in a sphere.
member.returns: The sphere unit vector representing the specified latitude and longitude.

member.name: T:ModApi.Mods.GameMod
member.summary: The base class for a singleton object representing a mod that is instantiated and initialize when the mod is loaded.

member.name: M:ModApi.Mods.GameMod.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:ModApi.Mods.GameMod.IsModRequiredForCelestialBody(ModApi.Planet.PlanetDataScript)
member.summary: Determines whether this mod is required to be installed and enabled in order for the game to be able to properly load and use this celestial body. Implementing this method is not required for custom planet modifiers as they will automatically cause the mod to be considered required for the celestial body.
member.returns: true if the mod is required for the specified celestial body; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ModApi.Mods.GameMod.IsModRequiredForCraft(ModApi.Craft.CraftData)
member.summary: Determines whether this mod is required to be installed and enabled in order for the game to be able to properly load and use this craft. Implementing this method is not required for custom parts and part modifiers as they will automatically cause the mod to be considered required for the craft.
member.returns: true if the mod is required for the specified craft; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ModApi.Mods.GameMod.IsModRequiredForFlightState(ModApi.State.IFlightStateData)
member.summary: Determines whether this mod is required to be installed and enabled in order for the game to be able to properly load and use this flight state. Flights states with modded crafts will automatically consider the crafts' required mods as required for the flight state. Implementing this should only be necessary if the mod somehow affects the flight state itself, not just modding crafts.
member.returns: true if the mod is required for the specified flight state; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ModApi.Mods.GameMod.IsModRequiredForPlanetarySystem(ModApi.Planet.SolarSystemDataScript)
member.summary: Determines whether this mod is required to be installed and enabled in order for the game to be able to properly load and use this planetary system. Implementing this method is not required for custom planet modifiers as they will automatically cause the mod to be considered required for the celestial body.
member.returns: true if the mod is required for the specified planetary system; otherwise false.

member.name: M:ModApi.Planet.ITerrainGenerator.GetVertexData(ModApi.Planet.VertexDataRequestType,UnityEngine.Vector3d,System.Nullable{UnityEngine.Vector3d},ModApi.Planet.TerrainGeneratorCacheData)
member.summary: Gets the vertex data for the specified position. The position must be normalized (magnitude = 1). If the cacheData is null, this will assume it is executing on the main thread (no safety checks!).
member.param: The type of vertex data being requested. This impacts which passes will be run.
The normal for the terrain at the specified position. If null, the normalized position will be used.

The terrain generator cache data to use with this request. This should not be shared between threads. If null is used, it will assume it is running on the main thread and use its cached data (no safety checks!).
member.returns: The vertex data for the specified position.

member.param: Index of the vertex in the quad (or zero if not generating quad data).
The cache data used by the terrain generator for the current thread.
member.returns: The vertex data for the specified position.

member.name: T:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration
member.summary: A class containing configuration information for distance blended textures.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration.TileLevelCount
member.summary: The tile level count.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration._distanceAdjustment
member.summary: The distance adjustment value that is added to the distance which determines the tiling level. This adjustment is applied after the distance scalar is applied. Example: If the first tiling level lasts until about 100 meters and this adjustment value is -500, then the first tiling level will last until about 600 meters.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration._distanceScalar
member.summary: The distance scalar used to adjust the distance at which the levels begin. Doubling this value will cause tiling levels to begin twice as early as normal.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration._levels
member.summary: The tiling levels.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration._scaledUvStartLevel
member.summary: The tiling level at which scaled UV coordinates start being used. If this is set to 3, then tiling levels 1, 2 and 3 will use scaled UV coordinates. The remaining tiling levels will used standard UV coordinates.

member.name: P:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration.DistanceAdjustment
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance adjustment value that is added to the distance which determines the tiling level. This adjustment is applied after the distance scalar is applied. Example: If the first tiling level lasts until about 100 meters and this adjustment value is -500, then the first tiling level will last until about 600 meters.

member.name: P:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration.DistanceScalar
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance scalar used to adjust the distance at which the levels begin. Doubling this value will cause tiling levels to begin twice as early as normal.

member.summary: Gets the levels.

member.name: P:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.Material.DistanceBlendedTexturesConfiguration.ScaledUvStartLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the tiling level at which scaled UV coordinates start being used. If this is set to 3, then tiling levels 1, 2 and 3 will use scaled UV coordinates. The remaining tiling levels will used standard UV coordinates.

member.name: T:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType
member.summary: An enumeration defining the different types of arithmetic operations that are available.

member.summary: Add the A and B inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Add_A_PLUS_C
member.summary: Add the A and C inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Subtract_A_MINUS_B
member.summary: Subtract the B input from the A input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Subtract_A_MINUS_C
member.summary: Subtract the C input from the A input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Subtract_C_MINUS_A
member.summary: Subtract the A input from the C input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Multiply_A_TIMES_B
member.summary: Multiply the A and B inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Multiply_A_TIMES_C
member.summary: Multiply the A and C inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Divide_A_By_B
member.summary: Divide the A input by the B input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Divide_A_By_C
member.summary: Divide the A input by the C input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Divide_C_By_A
member.summary: Divide the C input by the A input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Exponent_A_POW_B
member.summary: Raise the A input to the power of the B input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Exponent_A_POW_C
member.summary: Raise the A input to the power of the C input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Exponent_C_POW_A
member.summary: Raise the C input to the power of the A input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.AbsoluteValue_A
member.summary: Take the absolute value of the A input.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Min_AB
member.summary: Take the minimum value between the A and B inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Min_AC
member.summary: Take the minimum value between the A and C inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Max_AB
member.summary: Take the maximum value between the A and B inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Max_AC
member.summary: Take the maximum value between the A and C inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.BasicArithmeticType.Sign_A
member.summary: Get the sign of the A input (output should be -1 or 1).

member.name: T:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.Biomes.AddBiome

member.name: T:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.Biomes.LayeredBiomes
member.summary: A planet vertex data biome pass modifier that takes sets of inputs and converts them into biome strengths. Biome inputs are applied in layers with the higher priority ones taking precedence.

member.summary: The biome layers.

member.summary: The index of the default biome.

member.summary: An enumeration defining the different type of biome layer inputs.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.Biomes.LayeredBiomes.BiomeInputType.SingleBiome
member.summary: The biome input value represents the strength of a single biome from 0% at 0 to 100% at 1.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.Biomes.LayeredBiomes.BiomeInputType.DualBiome_NegativeAndPositive
member.summary: The biome input value represents two biomes. The primary biome strength is represented by values from 0 (0%) to 1 (100%). The other biome strength is represented by values from 0 (0%) to -1 (100%).

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.Biomes.LayeredBiomes.BiomeInputType.DualBiome_PositiveAndRemainder
member.summary: The biome input value represents two biomes. The primary biome strength is represented by values from 0 (0%) to 1 (100%). The other biome strengths is 100% minus the strength of the primary biome.

member.value: The pass in which this modifier runs.

member.summary: Generates a default cubemap for this modifier. The cubemap will be a linear grayscale texture with 6 faces positioned in a single horizontal row in the order of X+, X-, Y+, Y-, Z+, Z-.

member.name: M:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.CubemapData.BuildDefaultCubemap(System.Int32)
member.summary: Builds the default cubemap, which is based on the data at a particular data index at the point in time that this modifier would execute. This implementation is pretty hacky... The basic idea is to create new planet/terrain data scripts, but swap this modifier out for another. We then grab a reference to that modifier, which tracks the data value we care about every time vertex data is generated. Then we simple build the texture, grabbing the pixel values from the new terrain generator after generating each vertex data.
member.param: The size (width/height) of the individual cubemap face textures.
member.returns: The cubemap texture.

member.summary: The generated height is a result of linearly interpolating from the minimum height to the maximum height based off the input value.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexData.GenerateHeightType.LerpToFromZero
member.summary: The generated height is a result of linearly interpolating from the minimum height to zero if the input value is negative or linearly interpolating from zero to the maximum height if the input value is positive. This should not be used if the minimum and maximum heights to not span across zero.

member.returns: The byte array representing the cubemap encoded as a PNG.

member.name: T:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexDataPlanetModifierPassType
member.summary: The vertex data planet modifier pass types.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexDataPlanetModifierPassType.Biome
member.summary: The 'Biome' pass which runs first. This pass is responsible for setting the biome strength values. It may also set any other output data as well. The input position is available in this pass but the normal is not available. This pass is only ran for common modifiers and will not be executed for biome specific modifiers.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexDataPlanetModifierPassType.Height
member.summary: The 'Height' pass which runs second. This pass runs after the 'Biome' pass and is responsible for setting the height value. It may also set any other output data as well other than the biome strength values. The input position is available in this pass but the normal is not available. This pass is ran for common modifiers first and then executed for biome specific modifiers second.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexDataPlanetModifierPassType.HeightFinal
member.summary: The 'HeightFinal' pass which runs third. This pass is just like the Height pass but it runs after it and is useful for common modifiers that need to run after biome specific height pass modifiers. The input position is available in this pass but the normal is not available. This pass is only ran for common modifiers and will not be executed for biome specific modifiers.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexDataPlanetModifierPassType.Final
member.summary: The 'Final' pass which runs last for the terrain. This pass runs after all other terrain passes and is responsible for setting any remaining vertex data that has not been set. It may set any data other than the biome strength values and the height value. The input position and the normal position are both available in this pass. This pass is ran for common modifiers first and then executed for biome specific modifiers second.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.Modifiers.VertexDataPlanetModifierPassType.Water
member.summary: The 'Water' pass which runs after the 'TerrainFinal' pass. This pass is responsible for setting water related data such as color. This pass is ran for common modifiers first and then executed for biome specific modifiers second.

member.name: P:ModApi.Planet.IPlanetData.QuadSphereTransitionDistance
member.summary: Gets the distance over which the rendering is transitioned between the quad sphere and the scaled space renderer. The quad sphere is 100% visible at QuadSphereActivationDistance and the scaled space renderer is 100% visible at QuadSphereActivationDistance + QuadSphereTransitionDistance. If this is left at zero, then a default value will be used, which is the diameter of the planet.

member.name: M:ModApi.Planet.IPlanetData.GetWaveTime(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the time which should be used to animate wave physics/shaders. We can't just send in the float value of the current game-time b/c all the precision will be lost. This method keeps the time within the frequency of the planet's waves. It will always be between zero and the wave frequency.
member.param: The game-time to calculate the wave-time for.
member.returns: The time which should be used to animate wave physics/shaders.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.PlanetDataScript._quadSphereTransitionDistance
member.summary: The distance over which the rendering is transitioned between the quad sphere and the scaled space renderer. The quad sphere is 100% visible at QuadSphereActivationDistance and the scaled space renderer is 100% visible at QuadSphereActivationDistance + QuadSphereTransitionDistance. If this is left at zero, then a default value will be used, which is the diameter of the planet.

member.name: M:ModApi.Planet.PlanetDataScript.CreateFromFile(ModApi.CelestialData.CelestialFile,ModApi.Planet.CelestialBodyPlanetarySystemDefinedData,ModApi.Planet.PlanetDataScript,ModApi.Planet.SolarSystemDataScript,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates a celestial body data object from the specified file.
member.param: The file from which to create the celestial body data object.
The planetary system defined data for the celestial body.
The planetary system to which the celestial body belongs.
If set to true, terrain data will be created as well.
If set to true, the celestial body data will be scaled based on the scale settings and planetary level overrides will be applied to the celestial body (if any).
member.returns: The celestial body data object represented by the file.

The file associated with the celestial body data object.
The planetary system defined data for the celestial body.
The planetary system to which the celestial body belongs.
If set to true, terrain data will be created as well.
If set to true, the celestial body data will be scaled based on the scale settings and planetary level overrides will be applied to the celestial body (if any).
member.returns: The celestial body data object represented by the file.

member.param: The type of vertex data being requested. This impacts which passes will be run.
The normal for the terrain at the specified position. If null, the normalized position will be used.

member.name: T:ModApi.Planet.TerrainGeneratorDisposed
member.summary: A wrapper for a terrain generator that is going away. The purpose of this class is for it to be hot-swapped during quadsphere disposal to protected background threads from calling native noise methods after they have been disposed (and thus crashing the app). All native noise calls to this terrain generator return dummy data (as do some non-noise calls).

member.name: M:ModApi.Planet.TerrainGeneratorDisposed.GetVertexData(ModApi.Planet.VertexDataRequestType,UnityEngine.Vector3d,System.Nullable{UnityEngine.Vector3d},ModApi.Planet.TerrainGeneratorCacheData)
member.summary: Gets the vertex data for the specified position. The position must be normalized (magnitude = 1). If the cacheData is null, this will assume it is executing on the main thread (no safety checks!).
member.param: The type of vertex data being requested. This impacts which passes will be run.
The normal for the terrain at the specified position. If null, the normalized position will be used.

The terrain generator cache data to use with this request. This should not be shared between threads. If null is used, it will assume it is running on the main thread and use its cached data (no safety checks!).
member.returns: The vertex data for the specified position.

member.param: Index of the vertex in the quad (or zero if not generating quad data).
The cache data used by the terrain generator for the current thread.
member.returns: The vertex data for the specified position.

member.name: T:ModApi.Planet.VertexDataRequestType
member.summary: An enumeration defining the different types of vertex data requests from the terrain generator. This corresponds to the passes that could be run to generate the vertex data.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.VertexDataRequestType.HeightData
member.summary: A request for only height data from the terrain generator. This requests that the biome, height, and height final passes run.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.VertexDataRequestType.HeightAndBiomeData
member.summary: A request for height and biome data from the terrain generator. This requests that the biome, height, height final, and final passes run.

member.name: F:ModApi.Planet.VertexDataRequestType.AllData
member.summary: A request for all data from the terrain generator. This requests that all passes run.

member.summary: The setting is hidden, meaning it is fully functionally but not visible in the UI.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.Core.SettingState.HiddenReadOnly

member.name: T:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.CollidersQuality
member.summary: An enumeration defining the rag-doll physics quality levels.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.CollidersQuality.Off
member.summary: Collider quality - Off setting.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.CollidersQuality.On
member.summary: Collider quality - Normal setting.

member.name: T:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.DebrisRetentionQuality
member.summary: An enumeration defining the aggressiveness of discarding explosion debris based on their size.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.DebrisRetentionQuality.Low
member.summary: Debris retention - Low setting. Debris are aggressively discarded, including medium and some larger pieces.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.DebrisRetentionQuality.Medium
member.summary: Debris retention - Medium setting. Fewer large debris are discarded, but some medium pieces still are.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.DebrisRetentionQuality.High
member.summary: Debris retention - High setting. Only the smaller debris will be discarded.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.DebrisRetentionQuality.Ultra
member.summary: Debris retention - Ultra setting. Similar to high setting except some parts which would never have debris will have it now.

member.name: T:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.PartFracturingSizeQuality
member.summary: An enumeration defining the size and number of pieces a part's mesh will be fractured into.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.PartFracturingSizeQuality.Off
member.summary: PartFracturing - Off setting. Exploded parts will not fracture into smaller pieces.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.PartFracturingSizeQuality.Large
member.summary: PartFracturing - Large setting. Parts will fracture into fewer, large parts.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.PartFracturingSizeQuality.Medium
member.summary: PartFracturing - Medium setting. Parts will fracture into more, smaller parts.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.PartFracturingSizeQuality.Small
member.summary: PartFracturing - Small setting. Parts will fracture into many, even smaller parts.

member.name: T:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.ParticleEffectQuality
member.summary: An enumeration defining the particle quality levels.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.ParticleEffectQuality.Medium
member.summary: Particle quality - Medium setting. A less taxing particle effect shader

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.ExplosionsQualitySettings.ParticleEffectQuality.High
member.summary: Particle quality - High setting. Higher quality shader that responds to light conditions and have volumetric effects.

member.value: The lifetime in seconds of debris pieces.

member.summary: Gets the debris retention quality setting. High retention means fewer meshes/debris pieces are discarded.
member.value: The debris retention quality setting. High retention means fewer meshes/debris pieces are discarded.

member.summary: An enumeration defining the different quality levels for planet cubemaps.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.TerrainQualitySettings.PlanetCubemapQuality.Low
member.summary: The low quality setting for planet cubemaps. Low resolution textures will be used for distant planets, map view planets, and the main menu planet. Normal mapping will not be used.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.TerrainQualitySettings.PlanetCubemapQuality.Medium
member.summary: The medium quality setting for planet cubemaps. Low resolution textures and normal maps will be used for distant planets, map view planets, and the main menu planet.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.TerrainQualitySettings.PlanetCubemapQuality.High
member.summary: The high quality setting for planet cubemaps. Low resolution textures and normal maps will be used for distant planets and map view planets. Higher resolutions textures will be used for the current planet (in flight and map view) as well as on the main menu.

member.name: T:ModApi.Settings.TerrainQualitySettings.StructureNormalMapQuality
member.summary: An enumeration defining the different quality levels for normal mapping on terrain related structures (like launchpads and buildings).

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.TerrainQualitySettings.StructureNormalMapQuality.Off
member.summary: Terrain related structures (like launchpads, runways, and buildings) will not be normal mapped.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.TerrainQualitySettings.StructureNormalMapQuality.On
member.summary: Terrain related structures (like launchpads, runways, and buildings) will use normal mapping whenever possible.

member.summary: An enumeration defining the different texture quality levels for the planet's surface.

member.summary: Textures will not be applied to planet surfaces.

member.summary: Use 'fast' distance blended textures. More work is pushed off to the vertex shader at the cost of visual artifacts between blending levels.

member.summary: Use distance blended textures.

member.summary: Anisotropic filtering will never be used. Textures can look blurry at steep viewing angles.

member.summary: Anisotropic filtering will be used for some textures but not all textures. For those textures that use it, this improves the look of the textures at steep viewing angles.

member.name: F:ModApi.Settings.VisualEffectsQualitySettings.AnisotropicFilteringMode.ForcedOn
member.summary: Anisotropic filtering will always be used. This improves the look of textures at steep viewing angles.

member.param: The path of the XML in the resource database from which to build the user interface.
The action to execute when the layout is rebuilt.
The parent transform for the user interface. If null, this will attempt to use main canvas for the scene as its parent.
member.returns: The main script for the user interface as specified by the type parameter.

member.summary: Moves the collider along the specified direction until it is no-longer colliding with anything. If it isn't colliding w/anything, it won't be moved.
member.param: The transform to move to depenetrate the collider. This can be the collider itself, but is normally the attached rigidbody.
The direction to move the collider to depenetrate it.
The maximum distance allowed between the collider and the last collider it was penetrating. Lowering this value results in more precise placement, but takes more iterations.
The layer mask for what we're checking collisions against.

member.name: M:ModApi.Utilities.HasMinimalDifference(System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the two doubles have a "minimal difference" between them using the specified digits of precision. This is helpful to compare large numbers, which might have very little information after the decimal point, and thus would fail normal CompareDoubles() checks, but are otherwise extremely close with respect to their available digits of precision.
member.returns: true if the two doubles have a "minimal difference" between them using the specified digits of precision; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:ModApi.Utilities.HasMinimalDifference(UnityEngine.Vector3d,UnityEngine.Vector3d,System.Int32)
member.summary: Determines whether the two Vector3ds have a "minimal difference" between them using the specified digits of precision. This is helpful to compare large numbers, which might have very little information after the decimal point, and thus would fail normal CompareDoubles() checks, but are otherwise extremely close with respect to their available digits of precision.
member.returns: true if the two Vector3ds have a "minimal difference" between them using the specified digits of precision; otherwise, false.
